results.title: Pasteur's experiments
results.creator_credit: Masaji Hara, Yasuaki Okada and Gakken Company
results.brief_description: A puppet film which shows the history of experiments dealing with the spontaneous generation of life. Demonstrates that microbes do not arise spontaneously from meat. Good for showing the experimental method.

results.title: The Legend of Sleepy Hollow
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, David Adams, Nick Bosustow and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Visualizes the spectral spirits and twilight superstitions that haunted the drowsy Dutch settlement of Sleepy Hollow. Concerns the rivalry between Ichabod Crane and Brom Bones for the hand of Katrina Van Tassel, and how the Headless Horseman of Sleepy Hollow removes Ichabod from the scene. Screenplay by Joseph Cavella, based on the story by Washington Irving. Narrated by John Carradine.

results.title: Full fathom five
results.brief_description: A study of marine life, taken from the best footage of four outstanding underwater photographers. There is no narrative, instead the film is accompanied by electronic rock music.

results.title: Basic law terms
results.creator_credit: Robert Gordon, Noel Nosseck, Directions Unlimited Film Corporation and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Shows young people how the law can work for them rather than against them. Distinguishes civil law from criminal law, provides a dramatised explanation of torts and contracts, and defines the medieval practice of “outlawing” people for he who defies the law is outside of it. Presented by Joseph Campanella.

results.title: In the beginning. Part I
results.brief_description: Sir Kenneth Clark discusses Egypt and the Nile valley. Shows him travelling there and pointing out the ways isn which Egypt flourished as an early civilisation. Presents the art and architecture of that early time. Part I of a two part series. Suitable for upper secondary level. NB: Part II (reel 2) is missing

results.title: Electric flag
results.brief_description: About the crucial role television and film play in the running of a political campaign. Covers both the making of a candidate and the making of the film “The Candidate”. Points out that in a campaign ‘the general idea is to project energy, warmth, and decisiveness, without saying anything too specific’. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Closed Mondays
results.brief_description: In a combination of graphics and three-dimensional clay figures, a little man discovers the world of art. He sees an open door and wanders through into an art exhibition. Paintings come alive and move around him as he watches. As he turns to go, he himself is put on a pedestal and bronzed. A 1975 Academy Award winner. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Camera magic: the art of special effects
results.creator_credit: Jerry Samuelson, Paul Burnford and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates a variety of camera techniques which can be used to produce special effects with an ordinary 16mm or 8mm motion picture camera without employing special equipment. Shows rotation in space, multiple images, upside down and reverse action, instant appearance and disappearance of objects and people and fast and slow motion. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Jerry Samuelson, Paul Burnford and Pyramid Films

results.title: Concrete poetry
results.brief_description: Presents , against an interpretive visual and musical background, several works selected from an anthology of concrete poetry compiled by Emmett Williams, in order to demonstrate a new poetic form. The poets include: Ronaldo Azeredo, Carlo Belloli, Claus Bremer, Bob Cobbing, Ian Hamilton Finlay, Oecio pignatori, and Emmett Williams.

results.title: The Land: the South Pembrokeshire coast
results.creator_credit: Richard Guinea, Julia Spark and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description: This film concentrates on the main features of the coastal landscape of the south Pembrokeshire coast of southwestern Wales, showing how the two different rock types: old red sandstone and carboniferous limestone, have reacted to the erosive forces of wind, wave and weather. Suitable for secondary level.
